title: A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms
transcript:
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: When I was a child, my brother would tell me a bedtime story about the man who murdered our father."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Who stabbed him in the back and cut his throat. Who sat down on the Iron Throne and watched as his blood poured onto the floor.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: He told me other stories as well. About all the things we would do to that man once we took back the Seven Kingdoms and had him in our grasp.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Your sister pledged to send her army north.
JAIME LANNISTER: She did.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I don't see an army. I see one man, with one hand. It appears your sister lied to me."
JAIME LANNISTER: She lied to me as well. She never had any intention of sending her army north.
JAIME LANNISTER: She has Euron Greyjoy's fleet and 20,000 fresh troops. The Golden Company from Essos, bought and paid for. Even if we defeat the dead, she'll have more than enough to destroy the survivors."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: We""?"
JAIME LANNISTER: I promised to fight for the living. I intend to keep that promise.
TYRION LANNISTER: Your Grace, I know my brother-"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Like you knew your sister?
TYRION LANNISTER: He came here alone, knowing full well how he'd be received. Why would he do that if he weren't telling the truth?"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Perhaps he trusts his little brother to defend him, right up to the moment he slits my throat."
SANSA STARK: You're right. We can't trust him. He attacked my father in the streets. He tried to destroy my house and my family, the same as he did yours."
JAIME LANNISTER: Do you want me to apologize? I won't. We were at war. Everything I did, I did for my house and my family. I'd do it all again."
BRAN STARK: The things we do for love.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: So why have you abandoned your house and family now?
JAIME LANNISTER: Because this goes beyond loyalty.
JAIME LANNISTER: This is about survival.
BRIENNE: You don't know me well, Your Grace."
BRIENNE: But I know Ser Jaime. He is a man of honor. I was his captor once. But when we were both taken prisoner and the men holding us tried to force themselves on me, Ser Jaime defended me. And lost his hand because of it."
BRIENNE: Without him, my lady, you would not be alive. He armed me, armored me, and sent me to find you and bring you home because he'd sworn an oath to your mother."
SANSA STARK: You vouch for him?
BRIENNE: I do.
SANSA STARK: You would fight beside him?
BRIENNE: I would.
SANSA STARK: I trust you with my life. If you trust him with yours, we should let him stay."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What does the Warden of the North say about it?
JON SNOW: We need every man we can get.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Very well.
JAIME LANNISTER: Thank you, Your Grace."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Either you knew Cersei was lying and let me believe otherwise, or you didn't know at all. Which makes you either a traitor or a fool."
TYRION LANNISTER: I was a fool.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Not for the first time.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Cersei still sits on the throne. If you can't help me take it back, I'll find another Hand who can."
TYRION LANNISTER: I suspect one of you will be wearing this before it's all over.
GENDRY BARATHEON: Don't you have something better to do?
ARYA STARK: You make my weapon yet?
GENDRY BARATHEON: Just as soon as I'm done making a few thousand of these.
ARYA STARK: You should make mine first. And make sure it's stronger than this.
GENDRY BARATHEON: It's strong enough.
GENDRY BARATHEON: It's going to be safer down in the crypt, you know."
ARYA STARK: Are you going to be down in the crypt?
GENDRY BARATHEON: No, but-"
ARYA STARK: But you're a fighter.
GENDRY BARATHEON: I've done my share.
ARYA STARK: You've fought them?
GENDRY BARATHEON: I did. Some of them.
ARYA STARK: How many?
GENDRY BARATHEON: A few. That was enough.
ARYA STARK: What are they like?
GENDRY BARATHEON: Bad. Really bad.
ARYA STARK: Really bad""?"
ARYA STARK: Even a smith's apprentice can do better than ""really bad."" What do they look like? What do they smell like? How do they move? How hard are they to kill?"
GENDRY BARATHEON: Look, I know you want to fight. And I know you're not scared of rapers or murderers or-This is different. This is-this is death. You want to know what they're like? Death. That's what they're like."
ARYA STARK: I know Death.
ARYA STARK: He's got many faces.
ARYA STARK: I look forward to seeing this one.
ARYA STARK: My weapon?
GENDRY BARATHEON: I'll get right on it.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm sorry for what I did to you.
BRAN STARK: You weren't sorry then. You were protecting your family.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm not that person anymore.
BRAN STARK: You still would be, if you hadn't pushed me out of that window. And I would still be Brandon Stark."
JAIME LANNISTER: You're not?
BRAN STARK: No. I'm something else now.
JAIME LANNISTER: You're not angry at me.
BRAN STARK: I'm not angry at anyone.
JAIME LANNISTER: Why didn't you tell them?
BRAN STARK: You won't be able to help us in this fight if I let them murder you first.
JAIME LANNISTER: What about afterwards?
BRAN STARK: How do you know there is an afterwards?
TYRION LANNISTER: Well, here we are."
JAIME LANNISTER: Yes, here we are."
TYRION LANNISTER: Together again.
TYRION LANNISTER: And the masses rejoice.
JAIME LANNISTER: How do they feel about their new queen?
TYRION LANNISTER: She's your new queen too.
TYRION LANNISTER: They remember what happened the last time Targaryens brought dragons north. They'll come around once they see Daenerys is different.
JAIME LANNISTER: And she is? Different?
TYRION LANNISTER: She is.
JAIME LANNISTER: You're sure about her?
TYRION LANNISTER: I am.
JAIME LANNISTER: She didn't seem sure about you.
TYRION LANNISTER: It's hard to blame her. I made a mistake common to clever people. I underestimated my opponents.
JAIME LANNISTER: Hmm.
TYRION LANNISTER: Cersei told me the pregnancy had changed her. A chance for you both to start again. And I believed her.
TYRION LANNISTER: Was she lying about the baby too?
JAIME LANNISTER: No, that part is real."
JAIME LANNISTER: She's always been good at using the truth to tell lies. I wouldn't be too hard on yourself. She's fooled me more than anybody.
JAIME LANNISTER: What?
TYRION LANNISTER: She never fooled you. You always knew exactly what she was, and you loved her anyway."
TYRION LANNISTER: So we're going to die at Winterfell. Not the death I wouldo ve chosen. I always pictured myself dying in my own bed, the age of 80, with a belly full of wine and-"
BOTH: A girl's mouth around-
JAIME LANNISTER: Your cock.
TYRION LANNISTER: My cock.
TYRION LANNISTER: At least Cersei won't get to murder me. I'm sure I'll feel some satisfaction denying her that pleasure while I'm being ripped apart by dead men.
TYRION LANNISTER: Maybe after I'm dead I'll march down to King's Landing and rip her apart.
BRIENNE: Ser Jaime.
JAIME LANNISTER: Lady Brienne.
JAIME LANNISTER: He's come a long way.
BRIENNE: He's alright. Still has a lot to learn.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm sure you'll teach him. I've been told you're commanding the left flank.
BRIENNE: I am. It's, uh-it's good ground."
JAIME LANNISTER: It is.
BRIENNE: The rise, it should give us some advantage."
BRIENNE: If we can keep a tight formation, we might be able to beat them back."
JAIME LANNISTER: Yes, I think you're right."
BRIENNE: What are you doing?
BRIENNE: I think you know.
JAIME LANNISTER: I truly don't.
BRIENNE: We have never had a conversation last this long without you insulting me. Not once.
JAIME LANNISTER: You want me to insult you?
BRIENNE: No!
JAIME LANNISTER: Good.
JAIME LANNISTER: I came to Winterfell because-I'm not the fighter I used to be. But I'd be honored to serve under your command, if you'll have me."
BRIENNE: I better get back.
JORAH MORMONT: Forgive me, khaleesi."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Have you done something to offend me?
JORAH MORMONT: Many things.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Long ago and long forgiven.
JORAH MORMONT: But you did forgive, despite my failures. When I heard you'd named Tyrion your Hand, it broke my heart."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: When I named him Hand, I didn't know if I'd ever see you again."
JORAH MORMONT: You made the right choice.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I wasn't under the impression you liked him very much.
JORAH MORMONT: I didn't. His mouth hardly stopped moving between Volantis and Meereen. It was all I could do not to throw him in the sea.
JORAH MORMONT: But the mind behind all those words-
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: He's made mistakes. Serious mistakes.
JORAH MORMONT: As have we all. He owns his and learns from them.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: You're advising me to forgive the man who stole your position?
JORAH MORMONT: I am. And one other suggestion, if you'll allow me."
ROYCE: The moment we can get the last infantryman out onto the field, we should shut the gates."
SANSA STARK: Keep them open for as long as you can. There are still people coming in from the countryside.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Lady Sansa, I was hoping we could speak alone."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I thought you and I were on the verge of agreement before. About Ser Jaime.
SANSA STARK: Brienne has been loyal to me, always. I trust her more than anyone."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I wish I could have that kind of faith in my advisors.
SANSA STARK: Tyrion is a good man. He was never anything but decent towards me.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I didn't ask him to be my Hand simply because he was good.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I asked him to be my Hand because he was good, and intelligent, and ruthless when he had to be. He never should have trusted Cersei."
SANSA STARK: You never should have either.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I thought he knew his sister.
SANSA STARK: Families are complicated.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Ours certainly have been.
SANSA STARK: A sad thing to have in common.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: We have other things in common. We've both known what it means to lead people who aren't inclined to accept a woman's rule. And we've both done a damn good job of it, from what I can tell."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: And yet, I can't help but feel we're at odds with one another. Why is that? Your brother."
SANSA STARK: He loves you, you know that."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: That bothers you.
SANSA STARK: Men do stupid things for women. They're easily manipulated.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: All my life, I've known one goal"
SANSA STARK: I should have thanked you the moment you arrived. That was a mistake.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I'm here because I love your brother and I trust him, and I know he's true to his word. He's only the second man in my life I can say that about."
SANSA STARK: Who was the first?
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Someone taller.
SANSA STARK: And what happens afterwards? We defeat the dead, we destroy Cersei. What happens then?"
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: I take the Iron Throne.
SANSA STARK: What about the North? It was taken from us, and we took it back. And we said we'd never bow to anyone else again. What about the North?"
WOLKAN: Apologies, my lady. Your Grace."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: What is it?
THEON GREYJOY: My queen.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Your sister?
THEON GREYJOY: She only has a few ships, and she couldn't sail them here. So, she's sailing to the Iron Islands instead, to take them back in your name."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: But why aren't you with her?
THEON GREYJOY: I want to fight for Winterfell, Lady Sansa, if you'll have me."
MAN: Milord, we're not soldiers."
DAVOS: You are now. Look, I made it through most of my years without ever getting near a fight, but then I survived the Battle of the Bastards. Right outside these walls. If I can live through that, you can live through this. They'll outfit you with weapons at the forge. Right that way."
MAN: Thank you.
GILLY: When the time comes, you'll be down in the crypts."
GILLY: They're the safest place to be. Through that archway right over there.
WOMAN: Thank you.
TEELA: Which way should I go?
DAVOS: Which way do you want to go?
TEELA: All the children will be going below when the time comes.
TEELA: But both me brothers were soldiers. I want to fight too.
GILLY: That's good to hear. I'm going to be in the crypt with my son, and I'd feel a lot better with you down there to protect us."
DAVOS: I'm sure a lot of people would.
TEELA: All right. I'll defend the crypt, then."
TORMUND: My little crow.
JON SNOW: I thought we'd lost you.
TORMUND: Almost.
JON SNOW: How did you find each other?
EDD: We met up at the Last Hearth.
TORMUND: The dead got there first.
JON SNOW: The Umbers?
BERIC: Fighting for the Night King now.
TORMUND: We had to travel around them to get here. Whoever's not here now is with them.
JON SNOW: How long do we have?
TORMUND: Before the sun comes up tomorrow.
TORMUND: The big woman still here?
JON SNOW: They're coming.
JON SNOW: We have dragonglass and Valyrian steel.
JON SNOW: But there are too many of them.
JON SNOW: Far too many.
JON SNOW: Our enemy doesn't tire.
JON SNOW: Doesn't stop. Doesn't feel.
JON SNOW: We can't beat them in a straight fight.
JAIME LANNISTER: So, what can we do?"
JON SNOW: The Night King made them all. They follow his command. If he falls Getting to him may be our best chance.
JAIME LANNISTER: If that's true, he'll never expose himself."
BRAN STARK: Yes, he will."
BRAN STARK: He'll come for me. He's tried before, many times, with many Three-Eyed Ravens."
SAM TARLY: Why? What does he want?
BRAN STARK: An endless night. He wants to erase this world, and I am its memory."
SAM TARLY: That's what death is, isn't it? Forgetting. Being forgotten. If we forget where we've been and what we've done, we're not men anymore. Just animals. Your memories don't come from books. Your stories aren't just stories. If I wanted to erase the world of men, I'd start with you."
TYRION LANNISTER: How will he find you?
BRAN STARK: His mark is on me.
BRAN STARK: He always knows where I am.
JON SNOW: We'll put you in the crypt, where it's safest."
BRAN STARK: No. We need to lure him into the open before his army destroys us all. I'll wait for him in the Godswood.
SANSA STARK: You want us to use you as bait?
ARYA STARK: We're not leaving you alone out there.
THEON GREYJOY: He won't be. I'll stay with him. With the Ironborn. I took this castle from you. Let me defend you now.
DAVOS: We'll hold off the rest of them for as long as we can.
TYRION LANNISTER: When the time comes, Ser Davos and I will be on the walls, to give you the signal to light the trench."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Ser Davos is perfectly capable of waving a torch on his own. You'll be in the crypt.
TYRION LANNISTER: Your Grace, I have fought before, I can do it again. Alongside the men and women risking their lives."
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: There are thousands of them and only one of you. You can't fight as well as they can, but you can think better than any of them. You're here because of your mind. If we survive, I'll need it."
DAVOS: The dragons should give us an edge in the field.
JON SNOW: If they're in the field, they're not protecting Bran. We need to be near him. Not too near, or the Night King won't come. But close enough to pursue him when he does."
ARYA STARK: Dragonfire will stop him?
BRAN STARK: I don't know. No one's ever tried.
TORMUND: We're all going to die.
TORMUND: But at least we die together.
JON SNOW: Let's get some rest.
JON SNOW: Your Grace.
TYRION LANNISTER: Do you need help?
BRAN STARK: No.
TYRION LANNISTER: You've had a strange journey.
BRAN STARK: Stranger than most.
TYRION LANNISTER: I'd like to hear about it.
BRAN STARK: It's a long story.
TYRION LANNISTER: If only we were trapped in a castle, in the middle of winter, with nowhere to go."
MISSANDEI: Hello.
GREY WORM: When Daenerys takes her throne there will be no place for us here. I am loyal to my queen. I will fight for her until her enemies are defeated, but when the war is over and she has won, do you want to grow old in this place? Is there nothing else you want to do, nothing else you want to see?"
MISSANDEI: Naath. I'd like to see the beaches again.
GREY WORM: Then I will take you there.
MISSANDEI: My people are peaceful. We cannot protect ourselves.
GREY WORM: My people are not peaceful. We will protect you.
SAM TARLY: Have you told her yet?
JON SNOW: No.
SAM TARLY: Mm-hmm. Being careful. Biding your time. Waiting for the perfect-
EDD: And now our watch begins.
JON SNOW: Gilly? Little Sam?
SAM TARLY: They'll be safe down in the crypt.
JON SNOW: If you want to join them.
JON SNOW: To protect them.
SAM TARLY: Everyone seems to forget that I was the first man to kill a White Walker. I've killed Thenns.
EDD: Thenn.
SAM TARLY: I've saved Gilly more than once. I stole a considerable number of books from the Citadel library, survived the Fist of the First Men. You need me out there."
EDD: Well, if that's what it's come to, we really are fucked."
SAM TARLY: Well, calling you ""fucked"" wouldn't be strictly accurate."
EDD: Samwell Tarly. Slayer of White Walkers. Lover of Ladies. As if we needed any more signs the world was ending.
SAM TARLY: Think back to where we started. Us, Grenn, Pyp."
JON SNOW: Now it's just us three.
EDD: Last man left, burn the rest of us."
TYRION LANNISTER: I wish Father were here.
TYRION LANNISTER: I would love to see the look on his face when he realizes his two sons are about to die defending Winterfell.
JAIME LANNISTER: That would be something to see.
TYRION LANNISTER: I remember the first time we were here, the first time I saw this hall."
JAIME LANNISTER: Mm.
TYRION LANNISTER: You were a golden lion. I was a drunken whore-monger. It was all so simple.
JAIME LANNISTER: It wasn't so simple. I was sleeping with my sister and you had one friend in the world who was sleeping with his sister.
TYRION LANNISTER: I was speaking in relative terms.
JAIME LANNISTER: Do you miss it?
TYRION LANNISTER: Of course I miss it.
JAIME LANNISTER: Well, my golden lion days are done, but whore-mongering is still an option for you."
TYRION LANNISTER: It's not. Things would be easier if it were.
TYRION LANNISTER: The perils of self-betterment.
JAIME LANNISTER: Oh! My lady.
BRIENNE: Oh, we didn't mean to interrupt. We were just looking for somewhere warm to-"
TYRION LANNISTER: To contemplate your imminent death. You've come to the right place. You want some of this piss? It's not bad. It's not good either.
PODRICK: Thank you, milord."
BRIENNE: I don't think that's wise.
BRIENNE: The battle might start at any moment.
BRIENNE: Half cup.
TYRION LANNISTER: And you?
BRIENNE: No, thank you. I should try and get some sleep."
JAIME LANNISTER: You really think any of us are going to sleep tonight? Join us.
BRIENNE: All right. Just a bit.
DAVOS: Well, what do we have here?"
TYRION LANNISTER: Ser Davos, join us."
DAVOS: No, not for me, thanks. Came here for this."
DAVOS: I figured I could wait to die freezing my balls off out there or wait to die nice and warm in here.
TORMUND: It could be our last night in this world, you know."
BRIENNE: Yes, well, I'm glad you're here."
BRIENNE: Here fighting with us. Glad you survived Eastwatch.
TYRION LANNISTER: Would you like a drink?
TORMUND: Brought my own.
TORMUND: They call you ""King Killer."""
JAIME LANNISTER: I'm sure someone does.
TORMUND: They call me ""Giantsbane."" Want to know why?"
TORMUND: I killed a giant when I was ten. Then I climbed right into bed with his wife.
TORMUND: When she woke up, you know what she did? Suckled me at her teat for three months. Thought I was her baby. That's how I got so strong. Giant's milk."
DAVOS: Maybe I will have that drink.
SANDOR: You never used to shut up. Now you're just sitting there like a mute.
ARYA STARK: Guess I've changed.
ARYA STARK: What are you doing up here?
SANDOR: What's it look like?
ARYA STARK: No, I mean, what are you doing up here? You joined the Brotherhood. You went beyond the Wall with Jon. You're here now. Why? When was the last time you fought for anyone but yourself?"
SANDOR: I fought for you, didn't I?"
SANDOR: Oh, for fuck's sake. May as well be at a bloody wedding."
BERIC: My lady. It's good to see you again. I'm sorry we parted the way we did.
SANDOR: Was he on your list?
ARYA STARK: For a little while.
BERIC: That's all right.
BERIC: The Lord of Light has brought us together all the same. This is his moment. When light-
SANDOR: Thoros isn't here anymore, so I hope you're not about to give a sermon. Because if you are, the Lord of Light's gonna wonder why he brought you back nineteen times just to watch you die when I chuck you over this fucking wall."
SANDOR: Where are you going?
ARYA STARK: I'm not spending my final hours with you two miserable old shits.
ARYA STARK: That for me?
ARYA STARK: This'll work.
GENDRY BARATHEON: Last time you saw me, you wanted me to come to Winterfell. Took the long road, butâ€¦"
ARYA STARK: What did the Red Woman want with you?
GENDRY BARATHEON: She wanted my blood for some kind of spell.
ARYA STARK: Why your blood?
GENDRY BARATHEON: I'm Robert Baratheon's bastard.
GENDRY BARATHEON: I didn't know until she told me. Then she tied me up, stripped me down, put leeches all over me."
ARYA STARK: Was that your first time?
GENDRY BARATHEON: No, yeah, I've never had leeches put all over my cock."
ARYA STARK: Your first time with a woman.
GENDRY BARATHEON: What? I-I didn't-I wasn't with her.
ARYA STARK: Were you with other girls before that in King's Landing?
ARYA STARK: Or after?
ARYA STARK: You don't remember?
GENDRY BARATHEON: Yes, I was."
ARYA STARK: One? Two? Twenty?
GENDRY BARATHEON: Well, I didn't keep count."
ARYA STARK: Yes, you did."
GENDRY BARATHEON: Three.
ARYA STARK: We're probably going to die soon. I want to know what it's like before that happens.
GENDRY BARATHEON: Arya, I-"
ARYA STARK: I'm not the Red Woman. Take your own bloody pants off.
TYRION LANNISTER: It's strange, isn't it? Almost everyone here's fought the Starks at one time or another. And here we are in their castle, ready to defend it. Together."
BRIENNE: At least we'll die with honor.
TYRION LANNISTER: I think we might live.
TYRION LANNISTER: I-I do. How many battles have we survived between us? Ser Davos Seaworth. Survivor of both the Blackwater and the Battle of the Bastards.
DAVOS: All without a shred of combat ability.
TYRION LANNISTER: Mm. Ser Jaime Lannister, fabled hero of the Siege of Pyke."
JAIME LANNISTER: Fabled loser of the Battle of Whispering Wood.
TYRION LANNISTER: Hear, hear! Ser Brienne of Tarth. Defeated the Hound in-Pardon me, Lady Brienne."
TORMUND: She's not a ser? You're not a knight?
BRIENNE: Women can't be knights.
TORMUND: Why not?
BRIENNE: Tradition.
TORMUND: Fuck tradition.
BRIENNE: I don't even want to be a knight.
TORMUND: I'm no king. But if I were, I'd knight you ten times over."
JAIME LANNISTER: You don't need a king. Any knight can make another knight.
JAIME LANNISTER: I'll prove it.
JAIME LANNISTER: Kneel, Lady Brienne."
JAIME LANNISTER: Do you want to be a knight or not? Kneel.
JAIME LANNISTER: In the name of the Warrior, I charge you to be brave."
JAIME LANNISTER: In the name of the Father, I charge you to be just."
JAIME LANNISTER: In the name of the Mother, I charge you to defend the innocent."
JAIME LANNISTER: Arise, Brienne of Tarth a knight of the Seven Kingdoms."
TYRION LANNISTER: Ser Brienne of Tarth! Knight of the Seven Kingdoms!
JORAH MORMONT: We have all we need to win this war.
LYANNA: I have trained my men, women and children. I have fought before. I can fight again."
JORAH MORMONT: Please, listen to me. You're the future of our house."
LYANNA: I don't need you to remind me of that.
JORAH MORMONT: You'll be safer in the crypt. These things we're fighting-
LYANNA: I will not hide underground. I pledged to fight for the North, and I will fight."
SAM TARLY: Oh, I'm sorry, I didn't mean to-"
LYANN: It's all right. We're done here.
LYANNA: I wish you good fortune, cousin."
JORAH MORMONT: Thank you, my lady."
JORAH MORMONT: What have you got there?
SAM TARLY: It's called Heartsbane. It's my family sword.
JORAH MORMONT: You still have a family.
SAM TARLY: Yes. And I'd love to defend them with it. But I can't really hold it upright. Your father, he taught me how to be a man. How to do what's right. This is right. It's Valyrian steel. I'd be honored if you'd take it."
JORAH MORMONT: I'll wield it in his memory to guard the realms of men.
SAM TARLY: I'll see you when it's through.
SAM TARLY: I hope we win.
JAIME LANNISTER: We'd better get some rest.
TYRION LANNISTER: No, let's stay a bit longer."
DAVOS: We're out of wine.
TYRION LANNISTER: How about a song? One of you must know one. Ser Davos?
DAVOS: You'll pray for a quick death.
TYRION LANNISTER: Ser Brienne?
TORMUND: Mm-mm.
TYRION LANNISTER: Mmm.
PODRICK: High in the halls of the kings who are gone, Jenny would dance with her ghosts, the ones she had lost and the ones she had found and the ones who had loved her the most."
PODRICK: The ones who'd been gone for so very long.
PODRICK: She couldn't remember their names. They spun her around on the damp old stones.
PODRICK: Spun away all her sorrow and pain. And she never wanted to leave
PODRICK: Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave.
PODRICK: Never wanted to leave. Never wanted to leave.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Who's that?
JON SNOW: Lyanna Stark.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: My brother, Rhaegar, everyone told me he was decent and kind. He liked to sing. Gave money to poor children. And he raped her."
JON SNOW: He didn't. He loved her.
JON SNOW: They were married in secret. After Rhaegar fell on the Trident, she had a son. Robert would have murdered the baby if he ever found out, and Lyanna knew it. So the last thing she did, as she bled to death on her birthing bed, was give the boy to her brother, Ned Stark, to raise as his bastard."
JON SNOW: My name. My real name is Aegon Targaryen.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: That's impossible.
JON SNOW: I wish it were.
DAENERYS TARGARYEN: Who told you this?
JON SNOW: Bran. He saw it.

JON SNOW: It's true, Dany. I know it is."
